page.title: 11Home Life 2
page.content: A lovely spring morning. I am up at 6a.m.,feeding stale bread to a gang of local sparrows, and listening to the birds singing their morning songs. My first task is to clean out the fire, take out the ashes , bring in the coal and wood. These mornings are still chilly enough to warrant a fire, and its cheery, red glow brings warmth to the whole house. The garden demands attention, hoeing, planting,digging,weeding,the grass to be cut-and there is a lot of this-and this takes up most of my morning.I find time to visit the school library to change my books,and to attend to the Hydro-Electric man who asks to get into the village hall to read the meter.After lunch I spend some time scything long grass around my garage,then I take out my bicycle and ride to Dunning to do some shopping.
